intro: Dendranthema mutellinum, commonly known as the common chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features hairy, lobed leaves. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the autumn, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. The plant is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural pigments.
